instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> orange light no fan spin
threads.message:
I'm working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that shows orange light but no fan spin. I was able to find a short on <SIGNAL>PP15V_TBT</SIGNAL>. I relieved the short but still no signs of life. I have gone through the main voltages, s3,s5 and all of them are present. I notice the line <SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_TBTBST</SIGNAL> is 2.5v instead of 12.8v. 

Could this be preventing boot up? Any suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> orange light no fan spin
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_TBTBST</SIGNAL> should be 0V if nothing is connected on thunderbolt port.
Is better to remove <TRANSISTOR>Q3080</TRANSISTOR>, for test.
Post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> voltage.
